meanings.definition: To restore to a unified whole
meanings.sent1: After the repair, the mechanic is reintegrating all the parts of the engine.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is reintegrating the students after recess.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were reintegrating themselves back together, much to the surprise of the child.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts in reintegrating the team were like putting together a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The artist was reintegrating different colors to create a beautiful painting.

meanings.sent1: The family is reintegrating for a special dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: The team is reintegrating after a long break.
meanings.sent3: The lost friends were happily reintegrating at the reunion party.
meanings.sent4: The music festival is a place where people from all walks of life reintegrate to celebrate.
meanings.sent5: The community is reintegrating to support each other during tough times.

meanings.definition: To combine or bring back into a unified whole
meanings.sent1: The chef is reintegrating the flavors to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent2: The architect is reintegrating modern and traditional styles in the new building design.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers were reintegrating after being temporarily separated.
meanings.sent4: The author was reintegrating different storylines to form a cohesive plot.
meanings.sent5: The scientist is reintegrating various research findings to present a comprehensive report.
